The guard shack sits off the approach road (pause) like it was placed by a committee (pause) that feared weather and people equally. (pause)
The door has a steel pull handle. (pause) The card reader beside it glows faintly (pause) as if embarrassed to be awake.
The door is closed flush. Fresh wear on the latch side: tested recently, then stopped. (pause) No gap, no give. It’s locked.

A brass plate, scuffed to dull gold, sits beside a capped tube port. (pause)
Block letters read: “FORMS — INTAKE / OUTBOUND — DO NOT SEND FOOD.” (pause)
An arrow’s scratched under “OUTBOUND.” Like they didn’t trust the printed one.
